passages.text: Distilled and Packaged \(\Rightarrow\) Out take on the sector: Beverages results, Beauty, JDEP, Givaudan & more

European Staples performed in- line with the market in an eventful week with Food/ HPC outperforming. We published on European Beauty, anticipating a measured acceleration in the global beauty market during H2, driven by China and US demand; JDE Peet's announced its acquisition by KDP (covered by A Teixeira); and Givaudan with a CEO succession and 2030 strategy update. In Beverages, NABCA data showed Spirits volumes move back into growth in July on better on- trade. Pernod delivered a FY25 EPS beat on stronger margin delivery but cautioned on a weak Q126. Remy Cointreau upgraded FY26 EBIT guidance by c.LSD for the latest US tariffs, while RBREW delivered an in- line Q2 EPS and announced a new DKK 300m SBB. In Tobacco, BAT was dragged by the unexpected resignation of the CFO but reaffirmed the FY25 guide.

In HPC, Beauty- led week with weak reporting by Chinese peers - Proya, Botanee and Giant Biogene - flagging that 'rapidly changing external factors' impacted growth in Q225 while US retailer, ULTA (covered by Chris Horvers), delivered a beat and raise in Q225 while also taking a 'cautious approach given continued uncertainty around consumer spending'. In Views into H225 for EU Beauty, we summarise Beauty peers reporting in H125 with most players disappointing on top- line evidencing that demand challenges are persisting - we prefer BEI/ULVR. In Food, a dose of caffeine this week - with the announcement of JDEP's acquisition by KDP. We hosted a deep dive call for JDEP business. Givaudan announced its CEO succession as well as 2030 strategy and financial targets, including widening market adjacencies and 4- 6% top- line growth MT.

Beverages underperformed dragged by Soft Drinks and Spirits. Pernod Ricard beat on FY25 EPS driven by margins; however, management cautioned on a weak Q1 and provided an unclear FY26 outlook which along with FX and perimeter headwinds pulled back the shares. Remy Cointreau upgraded FY26 guidance for the latest US tariffs (15% vs. 30% assumed prior) now looking for an org. EBIT decline of MSD (vs prior M- HSD decline). RBREW delivered an in- line Q2 EPS with a miss on sales offset by stronger margin delivery and announced a new DKK 300m SBB. Tobacco was the weakest, dragged by sector rotation and for BAT by the unexpected resignation of its CFO.
In this edition, don't miss our take on the sector, earnings and more.

Source: J.P. Morgan estimates, Bloomberg Finance L.P. Note: Week to Thursday, August 28, 2025.

- JDE Peet's and KDP (covered by A Teixeira) announce acquisition agreement (25thAugust) | Keurig Dr Pepper and JDE Peet's on Monday announced a definitive agreement under which KDP will acquire JDE Peet's in an all-cash transaction, valuing JDEP at €15.7bn (at €31.85/share). The transaction is expected to close around mid-2026 with a \(\sim 69\%\) voting block of JDEP (including JAB) already committed to vote in favor of the deal. Link to JPM Note.

- Givaudan announces new strategic cycle targets and CEO succession (27thAugust) | Givaudan has announced its new strategic cycle targets and priorities, targeting 4-6% average organic sales growth for the strategic cycle to 2030 (compared with 4-5% over 2021-25) but leaves its FCF ambition unchanged at \(>12\%\) , and commits to its 2030 sustainability goals on nature, people and communities, whilst continuing to actively pursue acquisition opportunities aligned with strategic focus areas. The company has also announced its CEO succession, with Christian Stammkoetter, President Asia, Middle East & Africa at Danone, designated as CEO effective 1st March 2026. Link to JPM Note.

- Danone is expanding its US yogurt plant (27thAugust) | Danone is set to invest millions of dollars in expanding and upgrading its Minster, Ohio facility amid an "explosive growth" in yogurt. The investment will include a 48,000-square-foot expansion, a new production line and other enhancements, creating 30 full-time jobs. Link to Article.

- Danone announces an evolution of its leadership structure (26thAugust) | Danone has announced the next stage of its leadership structure, organizing operations into three geographic regions: EMEA, Asia Pacific, and Americas. Effective January 1, 2026, Pablo Perversi is appointed President EMEA, Bruno Chevot is appointed President APAC, and Henri Bruxelles is appointed President Americas, all reporting to Véronique Penchientai-Bosetta, Group Deputy CEO. Christian Stammkoetter, currently President for Asia, Africa, and the Middle East, will leave Danone at the end of the year after 19 years with the company. Link to Press Release.

- China Mengniu Dairy (covered by K Yin) reported 1H25 earnings (27thAugust) | JPM analyst Kevin Yin noted Mengniu's "liquid milk sales declined 11% yoy on intensifying competition (small brands offering price cuts on low raw milk cost)." He added "Mengniu noted that current end-demand (especially for 3Q25 a traditional high season) remains lukewarm and expects full-year 2025 sales to decline mid- to high single-digit (implying 2H25 sales growth would be similar to 1H25's -6.9%)." Link and Link to JPM Notes.

- India beauty retailer, FSN E-Commerce Ventures (covered by L Chopra), makes UK entry (27thAugust) | India's largest beauty retailer, FSN E-Commerce Ventures, owner of the Nykaa platform, is expanding its international presence by launching Kay Beauty in the UK through a partnership with Space NK. The brand will offer a variety of standard cosmetics for a range of skin complexions, including specialty products like kohl, an eyeliner-like product often used by South Asian women. Link to Article.

- Proya Cosmetics (covered by Q Yao) H125 revenue missed estimates (26th August) | Bloomberg reported that shares of Proya Cosmetics, a Chinese beauty company, "fell the most in more than four months after first-half revenue missed analysts' estimates amid growing competition and rising marketing cost." The company's revenue increased by 7.2% year-on-year to RMB 5.36 billion in the first half of 2025, which was lower than the Bloomberg consensus of RMB 5.53 billion. The article added that "Proya's sputtering growth shows weak consumer sentiment is also weighing on affordable brands. Revenue from its namesake flagship brand remained largely flat during the period." Link to Article.

- Ulta Beauty (covered by C Horvers) reported Q225 results (29th August) | JPM analyst Christopher Horvers noted "ULTA produced a very high quality beat with comps well-ahead of our raised-into-the-print forecast and strong flow-through to the bottom-line (along with merchandise margin expansion)." He added that "While the company wouldn't comment on QTD in our follow-up, ULTA noted that there has been no change in consumer spending patterns or category engagement and their share performance remains strong." Link to JPM Note.

- Texas Attorney General launches investigation into Gerber and Plum Organics (27th August) | Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton has initiated an investigation into baby food manufacturers, Gerber and Plum Organics, for allegedly selling and advertising products containing high levels of heavy metals like Arsenic, Lead, Cadmium, and Mercury, which pose risks to children's health. Paxton aims to address deceptive practices and ensure food safety, while Gerber defends its rigorous testing and compliance with FDA standards, emphasizing its commitment to providing safe and nutritious food for babies. Link to Article.

- Arla lifts forecast for branded sales (28th August) | Arla Foods anticipate a potential uplift in branded sales in 2025, expecting growth to improve in H225. Despite a -1.5% decline in branded revenue in H125 due to consumer "cautious in response to higher prices and economic uncertainty," CFO Torben Dahl noted "we expect the situation to improve as we move into the second half...and we anticipate that branded growth will be close to neutral for the full year." Link to Article.

- JM Smucker (covered by T Palmer) reported 1Q26 EPS miss (27th August) | JPM analyst Thomas Palmer noted "SJM 's \$0.03 1Q26 EPS miss was its first since fiscal 1Q20 (6 years), with U.S. Retail Coffee profit coming in light despite stronger-than-expected sales." On coffee, the company shared "as we continue to navigate a highly-inflationary environment with the green coffee commodity, we took another price increase in August, which is now beginning to show up on-shelf." Link to Article.

- BAT CFO Soraya Benchikh steps down, Javed Iqbal to be interim CFO (26th August) | BAT announced that CFO Soraya Benchikh has stepped down from her role as of 26 August. A recruitment process to identify a permanent successor to the role of CFO has been launched. BAT commented that Benchikh will remain available to support the transition until 31 December 2025. Javed Iqbal will take on the role of interim CFO. Iqbal is currently Director, Digital and Information, and recently acted as the Interim Finance Director from May 2023 until April 2024, before Benchikh's appointment. BAT also commented that it is "firmly on track" to deliver FY25 guidance (CC sales in the upper half of the \(+1 - 2\%\) range and organic EBIT \(+1.5 - 2.5\%\) ). Link to Note.

- Canada tariffs on US Spirits will be lifted from 1st Sep (27th August) | Canada announced it is lifting its 25% tariffs on US goods covered under USMCA FTA, incl. imported US spirits, effective 1st Sep. Alberta and Saskatchewan provinces were noted to have started allowing sale of US alcohol in June but other provinces such as Ontario still do not sell US imported products. Chris Swonger, President and CEO of DISCUS, noted the tariffs uplift decision as "a very positive sign" but commented that "until all provinces put American spirits back on their shelves it won't have much of an impact." Link to Article.

- Brown Forman (covered by A Teixeira) reported Q126 results with sales beat (28th August) | Brown Forman reported Q126 (to end Jul) organic sales \(+1\%\) (vs cons. \(-3.8\%\) ). Q1 EPS came at \$0.36 (cons. \$0.37). Q1 organic by region: US \(-2\%\) (Q4 \(-5\%\) ) with lower volumes of whiskey and tequila offset by shipments ahead of Jack Daniel's Blackberry launch and distributor transitions; Developed markets \(-9\%\) vs (Q4 \(-10\%\) ) due to soft consumer demand due to the macro and declines in Germany and UK; Emerging Markets \(+25\%\) (Q4 \(+12\%\) ) led by Brazil and Turkey and partially benefitted from increase in inventories; Travel Retail \(+7\%\) (Q4 \(-17\%\) ). By product implied Q1: Whiskey organic sales flat but lower volumes in US and Germany (Q4 \(-2\%\) ); Tequila \(+1\%\) (Q4 \(-9\%\) ) US tequila category remains competitive; and RTDs \(+9\%\) (Q4 \(+1\%\) ). Q1 gross margin \(+40\) bps due to divestitures partially offset by higher costs, unfavourable price/mix and FX headwinds. FY26 guidance was reiterated for organic net sales in LSD- decline and organic operating income in LSD- decline. Management commented, "We continue to anticipate the operating environment for fiscal 2026 to be challenging, with low visibility due to macroeconomic and geopolitical volatility as we face headwinds from consumer uncertainty, the potential impact from currently unknown tariffs." Link to Note.

- Coca Cola (covered by A Teixeira) reported to be reviewing sale of Costa Coffee (25th August) | Coca-Cola is reported to be reviewing strategic options for Costa Coffee chain, including a possible sale. The company has reportedly hired Lazard to advise on the process and has held early talks with a limited number of potential bidders, incl. private equity firms with indicative offers reportedly expected in early autumn. Link to Article.

- Carlsberg expands Vietnam brewery (27th August) | Carlsberg announced the inauguration of the newly-expanded Phu Bai brewery in Vietnam. The firm invested \$90m into the capacity expansion of the brewery by 50%, making the Phu Bai brewery as Carlsberg's largest beer production facility in Asia. The facility incorporates one of Vietnam's fastest packaging lines, new high-efficiency brew line, AI-enabled electric forklift fleet and real-time data dashboards. Andrew Khan, MD of Carlsberg Vietnam commented, "Phu Bai Brewery expansion reflects our
long- term commitment to Vietnam". Link to Article.

- Diageo announced strategic changes in North American manufacturing (28thAugust) | Diageo announced strategic changes in its North American manufacturing facilities with the closure of the Crown Royal bottling facility in Amherstburg, Ontario by February 2026. Diageo reaffirmed that "All Crown Royal will be mashed, distilled, and aged at our Canadian facilities". Diageo will maintain its significant footprint across Canada, including headquarters and warehouse operations in Greater Toronto and other bottling and distillation facilities in Gimli and Valleyfield. The bottling facility closure will unlock additional productivity and increase resiliency and capacity to scale, effectively meeting demand across markets and shifting some Crown Royal bottling volume to be closer to US. Link to Article.

- ABI to sell NYC distribution arm to Southern Glazer (21st August) | ABI announced plans to sell its NYC distribution arm to Southern Glazer. The transaction will retain all local Anheuser-Busch employees and utilise the existing Bronx facility. The new NYC division will now sell the entire portfolio of ABI. Link to Article.

- IWSR data shows softening Bourbon demand in US (24thAugust) | The latest data from IWSR shows softening Bourbon momentum and downtrading on constrained purchasing power. Bourbon volumes 2025 YTD are -2% (vs -1% in 2023, +5% CAGR in 2019-22), with standard American whiskey volumes -4% YTD (value -8%). By price-tier, losses at lower price tiers has been partly offset by +6% YTD volume growth in super-premium & above category (> $30.5 per 75cl bottle). Performance has varied by state with NYC/Texas/Pennsylvania/Illinois seeing premiumization trends (albeit at a slower rate), vs California/Florida/Kentucky seeing significant declines in premium and flatfish trends in standard-and-below price tiers. Link to Article.

- Diageo announces global partnership for Johnnie Walker with Sabrina Carpenter (29thAugust) | Diageo announced a multi-year global partnership with Grammy-winning artist, Sabrina Carpenter. The partnership is the first verse of Johnnie Walker's plans to collaborate with voices in music and shape the future of how and where people can enjoy Johnnie Walker Black Label. The campaign debuts globally alongside the final leg of her Short n' Sweet Tour, with content rolling out in key cities and across digital platforms. At select stops on the Short n' Sweet Tour, fans can enjoy Carpenter's signature Johnnie Walker Black Label cocktails including a Manhattan, a whisky sour and a whisky highball. Link to BBG Article.

- Carlsberg welcomes Torsten Steenholt as EVP Integrated Supply Chain (28thAugust) | Carlsberg announced Torsten Steenholt will join the Executive Committee, effective 1st Nov as the Group's new EVP for Integrated Supply Chain. Mr Steenholt will replace Victor Shevtsov, who will be stepping down. Mr Steenholt currently serves as Sr VP of Global manufacturing at Novonesis and has 11 years of prior experience in executive positions with Chr Hansen. Before that, he was part of the Carlsberg Group for 15 years, serving in various positions across markets and Group. Jacob Aarup-Andersen commented, "Torsten brings 25 years of supply chain expertise and senior leadership experience from food, drinks and biotechnology industries. He has a proven track-record of delivering best-in-class performance within an important focus area for Carlsberg Group." Link to Article.
